A number of experimental animal studies show that obesity during pregnancy promotes insulin resistance, 
impaired glucose tolerance, endothelial cell dysfunction, hypertension, hyperphagia and increased adiposity 
in offspring [43,47], which extends into adulthood [64]. Increased adiposity, glucose intolerance and altered 
appetite regulation are observed in the offspring with even mild maternal overeating [30]. Higher insulin
